translation.en: I'm down at the Scottish Provident cycle in Crickley.
I'm going to talk to a few of the seven to eight-year-olds.
translation.ko: 이곳의 7, 8세 아동 몇 명과 얘기를 해 보겠는데요

translation.en: The first person I'm gonna talk to is Mark Turton.
What's the season been like for you?
Quite good.
But I've had a few crashes here and there.
[reporter] Down here we have Joseph Dooley.
He's in the under sixes. Joseph, what are you going--
No, I'm seven.
Oh, you're seven? [laughs]
Right, now we come to the really fast man.
And he's Mark Cavendish.
Mark is going to the Scottish Provident Challenge '96.
How do you think your form's going, Mark?
-Okay. -Okay.
How are you going tonight?
Okay. I did better than I thought I would.
-Did you win, or were you second? -No, I was about that far.
translation.ko: - 우승했나요, 2위였나요? - 못했지만 격차는 별로 안 났어요

translation.en: Christian won, as he keeps saying. [chuckles]
Okay, well, Mark's going to Challenge '96.
Thank you. We'll let them get on with the race,
they're just about to start and the first line is off.
translation.ko: 경기가 시작될 참입니다 첫 줄 선수들이 출발합니다

translation.en: [commentator 1] A world champion at 21.
[commentator 2] Mark Cavendish, youngest British rider to get a stage win at the Tour de France.
translation.ko: 최연소 영국 선수 마크 캐번디시가 이번 스테이지 1위입니다

translation.en: [commentator 3] He is the fastest man in the world right now.
There's nobody even comparing.
[commentator 1] There's the Missile.
[commentator 2] 70 km/h, what a sprint.
[commentator 1] He has gotten the victory.
No British cyclist has ever been remotely close.
translation.ko: 그 어떤 영국 사이클 선수도 이 정도 성과를 낸 적은 없습니다

translation.en: Win number 25.
[commentator] Already, he's taken the third most victories
in Tour de France history.
[reporter] From perfection, where do you go?
What a way to stick it to everyone else.
translation.ko: 제 실력을 확실히 보여준 멋진 경기였네요

translation.en: -[indistinct chatter] -Fuck off.
Is this live?
-[man] Yeah. -Oh, sorry.
[commentator] Cavendish has been disqualified from today's sprint.
You know that little thing in your mind
translation.ko: 이런 생각이 어렴풋이 들 때 있잖아요

translation.en: that says, "I shouldn't really do that."
[commentator] Oh, Mark Cavendish is down.
[reporter] Mark, how are you feeling?
[man 2] We get a lot of questions about Mark Cavendish.
[man 2] He hasn't got it anymore.
[woman] The harder things got, the less he talked to anyone.
translation.ko: 남편은 상황이 어려울수록 사람들에게 입을 안 열어요

translation.en: [man 3] Stop cycling and start a different life.
translation.ko: 선수 생활을 관두고 새 인생을 살라고요

translation.en: You don't go from being the best in the world…
to nothing.
I'd been many years…
just a winning machine.
[man in French] The Missile of the Isle of Man, Mark Cavendish.
[in English] Without the Tour de France, cycling doesn't exist.
translation.ko: 투르 드 프랑스가 없으면 사이클은 존재하지 않죠

translation.en: Even before I rode the Tour de France,
I was obsessed with it.
These bike riders suffering all these incredible distances
for three weeks in July.
It's addictive. It's…
it's savage, but so beautiful.
So beautiful.
We race 21 individual stages
over 3,500 kilometers.
A rider wins one stage of the Tour de France,
translation.ko: 투르 드 프랑스의 한 스테이지에서 우승한다?

translation.en: it makes their whole career.
Not just their year, their whole career.
translation.ko: 그해 기준이 아니라 평생 경력에서 말이죠

translation.en: One stage.
At this point in my career,
I'd been racing ten years.
I'd won 26 stages.
[announcer in French] Here is one of the superstar international sprinters,
Mark Cavendish!
[Peta Cavendish] It's just like a complete circus.
It's carnage.
[man] That's so cool. All done.
I try to make it as much as an adventure as I can for the kids.
When I met Mark, I was a model,
and the photographer we were with said,
"Do you know that he's a really good cyclist?"
translation.ko: '마크가 실력 좋은 사이클 선수인 거 알죠?'

translation.en: And I was like, "Well, brilliant."
I'd never watched a bike race in my life.
translation.ko: 평생 자전거 경주라곤 본 적 없었거든요

translation.en: Cycling's really quite a confusing sport.
But I realized what a huge part of Mark's life this was.
translation.ko: 그런데 이게 마크 인생에서는 큰 부분을 차지한다는 걸 깨달았죠

translation.en: So if I wanted to understand Mark, I had to understand cycling.
You have to have tunnel vision.
translation.ko: 선수는 제한된 시야를 가지고 있어야 하죠

translation.en: You have to be able to block out all the noise,
all the distraction, and focus 100% on what you need.
translation.ko: 필요한 것에 100% 집중할 수 있어야 해요

translation.en: I had my trusted teammate Bernie Eisel
translation.ko: 제겐 믿음직한 동료 베르니 아이젤이 있었어요

translation.en: who'd been with me most of my career.
You put your life in people's hands.
translation.ko: 자기 인생을 사람들 손에 맡기는 거예요

translation.en: You have to trust they're gonna give you everything they have.
translation.ko: 그리고 그 사람들이 최선을 다할 거라 믿어야 하죠

translation.en: You see his emotions and he says he's nervous,
translation.ko: 마크가 저런 감정을 느끼고 긴장된다고 하니

translation.en: so the last thing I should be, is to be nervous.
We were like a married couple.
We have spent probably 180 days per year in a hotel room together.
Bernie Eisel.
The best looking man
in the history
of cycling.
We definitely saw each other more than we saw our wives.
translation.ko: 저희 둘은 아내보다 서로를 더 많이 봤어요 "베르니 아이젤 전 프로 사이클 선수"

translation.en: [whispers] Bernie?
Do you think we should get up?
[announcer] The race is underway.
3,535 kilometers between the peloton and Paris in the final.
[Bernie] Cav is a sprinter.
Paired with athletics, you have a marathon runner.
You have a 100-meter sprinter.
Cav has to do both over three and a half weeks.
translation.ko: 캐브는 3주 반 동안 그 둘이 다 되어야 해요

translation.en: You've got 180 best bike riders in the world.
translation.ko: 세계에서 가장 뛰어난 사이클 선수 180명이 모이고

translation.en: Everything's at just another level.
[commentator] There's been a fall. Contador is down.
Contador, battered and bruised.
[Peta] The pressure's high. Everyone's nervous. There's often crashes.
translation.ko: 압박감도 심하죠 다들 긴장해요, 충돌도 흔하고요

translation.en: Everyone's going to go all guns blazing.
Everyone wants that chance at the yellow jersey.
translation.ko: 누구든 그 노란 운동복을 입길 원하니까요

translation.en: [Mark] The yellow jersey is worn by the leader of the race overall.
translation.ko: 노란 운동복은 모든 경기의 종합 1위가 입는 옷이에요

translation.en: It was really quite rare for a sprinter to be able to get it.
translation.ko: 스프린터가 입는 일은 정말 흔치 않죠

translation.en: I hadn't worn the yellow jersey at the Tour de France.
It's about the only thing I hadn't done.
This year's my chance, you know.
[commentator] Mark Cavendish might have a problem here.
Fucking prick!
Shake of the head as that motorbike went past.
Looking for the team car for a bike change.
translation.ko: 자전거 교체를 위해 팀 차량을 찾는군요

translation.en: Problems for Dimension Data.
Hoping to get Cavendish back to the top of the podium
as a stage winner.
[Bernie] My job was always to keep Cav
translation.ko: 제 일은 경주 내내 캐브가 무리에서

translation.en: in a safe spot in the peloton through the whole race.
translation.ko: 늘 안전한 위치에 있도록 하는 거였어요

translation.en: You have to protect him.
Shelter him from the wind.
Make sure there's nothing that makes him crash.
Get him to the front, drop him off at 180 meters to go.
translation.ko: 그렇게 선두로 이끌어 결승선 180m 앞까지 데리고 가요

translation.en: The only thing he has to do is head down
and sprint as fast as he can to the finish line.
[commentator] Going so fast. They're over a kilometer to go now.
And then there was this big, long straight finish slightly uphill.
translation.ko: 오르막이면서 길게 뻗은 거대한 최종 코스가 있었어요

translation.en: But the speed we were doing was phenomenal.
[commentator] Cav going towards the sprint finish now, riding at 65 km/h.
translation.ko: 시속 65km로 최종 지점을 향해 전력 질주하는 캐브입니다

translation.en: There's a big crash just behind!
Spearing up through the center,
it's Peter Sagan. He wants a piece of today as well.
[Peta] Mark wasn't really anywhere.
And all you could hear in the commentary was, "Kittel, Kittel, Peter Sagan."
translation.ko: 해설자가 외치는 이름이라곤 키텔 아니면 페테르 사간이었죠

translation.en: [commentator] Peter Sagan comes through the line!
Peter Sagan, the world champion!
I was coming,
and the line's coming,
felt Kittel on my left…
[commentator] Cavendish comes from absolutely nowhere.
The Manx Missile!
Yes! He takes it!
He gets the yellow jersey! He nails it!
-Wow, Mark Cavendish! You beauty! -[cheering]
translation.ko: 맙소사, 마크 캐번디시! 이런 멋진 선수가 있습니까!

translation.en: I just remember us all screaming and cheering and Frey bursting into tears
translation.ko: 다들 소리 지르고 환호하고 그렇게 소리를 지르니

translation.en: 'cause we'd all screamed so loud
that it scared the absolute life out of him.
-What a sprint. -Well done, Cavendish!
Well done!
Good on you, mate. Well done.
[announcer] Well, he's the center of the world's attention again, Mark Cavendish.
translation.ko: 마크 캐번디시가 또다시 세상의 이목을 끕니다

translation.en: Justifiably so.
[man in French] It's Mark Cavendish putting the yellow jersey on.
[Peta in English] It's very rare for the sprinters to wear it.
translation.ko: 스프린터가 그걸 입는 일은 정말 흔치 않아요

translation.en: It isn't normally something that Mark would get the opportunity to go for.
[man in French] Look how happy he is.
He's never worn this jersey,
translation.ko: 지금껏 입어 본 적 없었던 옷을

translation.en: and he's wearing it today.
[Mark in English] It was incredible.
This is the most iconic item of clothing in sport.
translation.ko: 스포츠계에서 가장 상징적인 물건 중 하나예요

translation.en: I'd done everything else I could do, I'd never worn one.
translation.ko: 최선을 다해도 입어 볼 수 없었고요

translation.en: [commentator] This victory moves Cavendish
one step closer to beating Eddy Merckx's all-time record of stage wins.
translation.ko: 에디 메르크스의 스테이지 우승 기록 경신에 더 가까워졌습니다 "투르 드 프랑스 스테이지 우승 최고 기록"

translation.en: [Peta] All of a sudden, everybody starts with this narrative of,
"Is Mark going to break Eddy Merckx's record?"
[commentator] Mark Cavendish makes it win number 28.
-[indistinct chatter] -I can't believe it!
[Bernie] The great Eddy Merckx, I mean, he's just a legend.
Breaking the historic record of Eddy Merckx
translation.ko: 그런 에디 메르크스의 역사적 기록을 경신하는 건

translation.en: was somewhere in the clouds in our heads.
[commentator] Cavendish gets there!
Win number 29. He's closing in on Merckx.
The thing with Eddy Merckx's record,
I never started that. That wasn't me.
All of a sudden, it's all I'm going for.
translation.ko: 그런데 갑자기 그게 제 목표가 됐어요

translation.en: [commentator] Four stage wins this year.
Will Cavendish return in 2017
and claim that record?
Fuck.
[sighs] Like, people had always only talked about Merckx.
Now I've got to beat Merckx.
translation.ko: 제가 이겨야 하는 사람이 돼 있었죠

translation.en: For fuck's sake.
It doesn't matter who I beat. I'll beat everyone.
translation.ko: 상대가 중요하진 않아요 누구든 다 이기는 거죠

translation.en: [Bernie] Good luck, man.
You going to time it, or do you want me to?
[Bernie] Yeah.
[Mark] I always need to be doing something
translation.ko: 난 손을 계속 움직일 수 있는

translation.en: that keeps your hands busy, really.
I think my record is at 1 minute 20.
If I don't get it under two minutes then I'm usually upset.
translation.ko: 2분 안에 못 끝내면 그게 그렇게 짜증이 나

translation.en: Yeah, he's definitely obsessive with many things.
Starting to get stressed now.
[Bernie] He needs control.
Like a nervous tic.
[Mark] Uh… There we go, stop.
To freak him out, I would just leave a cupboard open.
translation.ko: 마크를 당황하게 하려면 찬장 문만 열어놔도 돼요 그냥 활짝요

translation.en: Just leave it open.
Just wait 'til he explodes.
Everything was to perfection. And that's how he worked.
translation.ko: 모든 게 완벽해야만 했죠 그게 마크 방식이에요

translation.en: That's how he became
the best sprinter in the world.
It can be definitely one of those aspects that really brings you to the top.
translation.ko: 그게 한 사람을 최고로 만드는 특성이 될 수도 있어요

translation.en: But it also can break you.
'Cause it's a lot of pressure that you build up to yourself.
The whole of the team was built around me.
You feel that pressure.
[commentator] Even one stage victory will take him so close
translation.ko: 한 스테이지에서만 우승해도 에디 메르크스가 쌓은

translation.en: to Eddy Merckx's all-time record in the Tour de France.
translation.ko: 투르 드 프랑스 최고 기록에 가까워집니다

translation.en: Mark's on 30. And Merckx is on 34.
[Mark] It's fucking noisy.
There's helicopters.
Motorbikes.
Crowds.
-There's riders shouting at each other. -[riders shouting]
A wall of noise and you have to try and focus.
[commentator] This is where the drive has to come,
but where is Mark Cavendish?
He's about two or three riders back at the moment.
translation.ko: 한 두세 명 뒤에 있는 것 같군요

translation.en: Get him forward then sprint to the line.
[commentator] 400 meters to go. There's Sagan, now pushing.
Cavendish trying to force a gap on the right.
Oh, he hits a barrier!
That was a violent crash for Mark Cavendish.
[commentator] And that looks deliberate.
In the bus, I see that injured athlete,
and I see the replay and I see how he…
he comes from behind and I see that Mark would have won.
translation.ko: 뒤에서부터 나왔고 마크가 이겼을 수도 있겠더군요

translation.en: What would you put someone into the barriers for?
Doing 70 km/h.
[Rolf] There was no other scenario
than him winning that stage if he doesn't crash there.
[Mark] 100% I'd win that stage.
[Rolf] You immediately get into this angry mode.
I posted the only tweet I ever tweeted in my life, kind of like,
translation.ko: 살면서 처음으로 트위터에 글을 올렸죠, 이런 내용이었어요

translation.en: "Pure violence. Let's see what UCI is going to do about it."
translation.ko: '폭력 그 자체 UCI가 어떻게 대처할지 보죠'

translation.en: We decided to disqualify Peter Sagan from Tour de France 2017
translation.ko: "필리페 마린 심사 위원장" 동료 선수들을 위험에 빠뜨린 페테르 사간 선수는

translation.en: as he endangered some of his colleagues seriously.
translation.ko: 2017 투르 드 프랑스에서 실격 처리하기로 했습니다

translation.en: For sure I don't agree with them
translation.ko: "페테르 사간 프로 사이클 선수" 동의할 수 없는 결정입니다

translation.en: because I think I didn't do something wrong.
Mark, how are you feeling?
Peter Sagan's been disqualified from the Tour, what's your reaction?
translation.ko: 사간 선수가 대회에서 실격 처리됐는데 어떠십니까?

translation.en: It's the first I've heard of it. Um…
I don't know. The jury will do what they do, um…
translation.ko: 모르겠군요, 심사 위원들은 해야 할 일을 하는 거겠죠

translation.en: I was a little bit confused with the elbow, in a way.
That's something I'd like to speak to him about anyway.
translation.ko: 이건 선수와 한번 대화해 보고 싶은 부분이네요

translation.en: [man] Thanks, Mark.
[commentator] The Tour is now without it's greatest ever sprinter,
translation.ko: 투르 드 프랑스에서 세계 최고의 스프린터인

translation.en: and the world champion.
[Mark] Fucking raging.
I nearly lost my finger.
Got a hole in my shoulder blade.
[Peta] Mark wasn't good.
He was really struggling with the crash in particular.
[Mark] I felt like I had jet lag, you know.
Tired. Just all the time tired.
He would sit down and be asleep in a second.
He would walk to the top of the stairs and would fall asleep.
I said to…
doctor, "Sorry, something's not right."
"I need to get a blood test this week."
translation.ko: 이번 주에 피 검사를 해 봐야겠다고 했죠

translation.en: [Peta] And we got a text message from the team doctor,
"Cav, you've got Epstein-Barr."
I was like, "What's Epstein-Barr?"
Turns out it's quite common in endurance athletes.
translation.ko: 알고 보니 지구력 운동을 하는 선수들에게 흔한 거였어요

translation.en: It can tip very easily into chronic fatigue.
translation.ko: 쉽게 만성 피로를 느낄 수 있대요

translation.en: Irreversible chronic fatigue.
There's no medicine that can make it better.
Only rest.
It could wipe out half a season.
I had about six weeks off the bike.
But I wanted to race.
[Rolf] Was he ready for Sanremo?
Even if he wasn't in great shape,
he could still pull something off just out of his talent.
translation.ko: 재능만으로 뭔가 해낼 수 있는 선수였어요

translation.en: [Peta] I'm at home with the kids, watching.
50K to go, still there.
20K to go, still there.
And I'm thinking, "He could maybe do this."
[commentator 1] Mark Cavendish giving himself a very good opportunity here.
-We've got a crash! -[commentator 2] Whoa!
[commentator 1] Dimension Data rider down there on the right-hand side.
It's Mark Cavendish down at the back.
[commentator 2] He hit the yellow bollard.
[Peta] The kids are like, "Is he all right?"
So I took them into the other room,
and when I came back he was still on the floor.
translation.ko: 갔다가 돌아왔는데 마크가 여전히 바닥에 있더군요

translation.en: [commentator 1] Here it is on the right-hand side, Mark Cavendish.
translation.ko: 바로 이 부분 우측입니다 캐번디시가 보이죠

translation.en: -[commentator 2] Oh, my God. -Oh, no! Oh, no!
[commentator 2] That's horrible.
[commentator 1] And that is something we do not need to see.
-[commentator 2] God. Yeah. -[commentator 1] We hope he's okay.
I'd seen enough crashes with Mark to know that that was a long time
translation.ko: 마크가 충돌한 걸 자주 봤기에 그리 오래 쓰러져 있는 건

translation.en: that he hadn't got up.
He sounded scared,
and he said, "Girl, I can't feel my legs."
Yeah, it's terrifying.
Man, it's terrifying.
My heel was fucked.
My knee was fucked.
My hip was fucked.
Like, I couldn't walk.
The crash was odd because,
I mean, Mark did do Sanremo so many times before.
translation.ko: 산레모는 마크가 수도 없이 달렸던 곳이거든요

translation.en: He knows he has to take that roundabout.
It didn't make any sense to me.
I just couldn't make sense of how he'd hit a traffic island.
translation.ko: 대체 어쩌다 그 교통섬을 들이받은 건지요

translation.en: [Lance] Mark Cavendish had another major crash.
translation.ko: 마크 캐번디시에게 또다시 큰 충돌이 있었습니다

translation.en: It's kinda indescribable the way he hit that barrier
translation.ko: 그 장애물을 친 방식이 뭐라 표현할 수가 없어요 "랜스 암스트롱 전 프로 사이클 선수"

translation.en: and literally launched.
Like he was in the fucking Olympics.
I gave it a ten.
-[chuckles] -I gave it a ten.
[Rolf] The media picks up.
Suddenly he was too old
and his reaction time wouldn't be good enough anymore,
translation.ko: 멈춰야 할 때 반응 속도가 느린

translation.en: and he should probably stop.
[interviewer] Do you start to get a reputation
as a guy that goes down, to stay away from?
[man] Yeah, absolutely.
"Don't ride behind that guy." [chuckles]
It was like, "Shut the fuck up."
"You don't know what you're on about."
Ten years before, people were saying I was finished.
translation.ko: 자그마치 10년 전인데 제가 끝났다고 했던 거예요

translation.en: Ten years.
The media and him both treated each other
with an equal level of contempt.
He felt like they were trying to trip him up all the time.

climbing faster than before.
He was like a 20-year guy who's hungry for his first win of his life.
translation.ko: 마크는 마치 생애 첫 우승에 목마른 스무 살 같았습니다

translation.en: I'd push harder and harder and harder.
But, fuck me, I was going good, you know.
[Vasilis] He was like Rocky Balboa.
Rocky Balboa training to beat Drago.
He was lying completely dead,
translation.ko: 훈련 중에 죽은 듯이 바닥에 뻗고

translation.en: down on the floor, he was vomiting.
He told me, "Vasi, I hate you."
I said, "Thanks, thanks a lot."
"That's special."
"If you hate me after a session, that's a good sign."
translation.ko: '훈련이 끝나고 내가 밉다면 그건 좋은 신호야'

translation.en: "Thank you." [chuckles]
♪ Come on, Daddy! Come on, Daddy! ♪
[Vasilis] He just wanted to get the win
so his kids could see him win again.
I see 300 to go, I'm still five back.
translation.ko: 300m 남았는데 제 앞엔 다섯 선수나 있었죠

translation.en: That was like, [sighs] "That's not so good." "He's going to lose some speed now."
translation.ko: 전 생각했죠, '이러면 안 되는데 이젠 속도도 못 낼 거야'

translation.en: [commentator] Mark Cavendish locked out of it, I'm afraid.
translation.ko: 마크 캐번디시는 꼼짝 못 하는 신세예요

translation.en: I turn left in the final, a few back.
translation.ko: 최종 구간에서 왼쪽으로 꺾었는데 여전히 몇 명 있더군요

translation.en: [Vasilis] I get nervous.
He's in the fifth, sixth wheel. He's trying to find a way.
translation.ko: 다섯 번째 정도였고 방법을 찾는 중이었어요

translation.en: The wind's coming from the right,
and I can pass Philipsen, but the line's coming.
translation.ko: 필립선을 제칠 수는 있는데 결승선이 가까웠어요

translation.en: I come at him, come at him.
I reckon if I dive left,
I'll get a bigger run because I'll get in the slipstream.
translation.ko: 저항이 줄어들며 속도를 낼 수 있을 것 같더군요

translation.en: [Vasilis] Go, go, Mark.
He sees a space, he's done it!
[commentator] Mark Cavendish has done it! First win since 2018!
translation.ko: 마크 캐번디시가 해냅니다! 2018년 이후 첫 우승입니다!

translation.en: What about that? He is so pleased.
I am so pleased.
Whoo-hoo! Great race, man.
Congratulations, man.
You deserve so much for that.
You deserve so much.
[commentator] Good things come to those who wait.
translation.ko: 때를 기다리는 자에겐 좋은 결과가 따르는군요

translation.en: And that was a mighty long wait.
Wow. He did it.
The winner is back.
I hadn't felt that for a while, like, you know.
[Vasilis] He proved everybody wrong. We did our job.
translation.ko: 사람들이 틀렸다는 걸 증명했어요 저희는 저희 일을 했고

translation.en: And we did brilliantly.
It was just the Tour of Turkey.
Every race is important, but, you know,
I knew it wasn't the Tour de France.
There was no chance.
There was no chance of him going to the Tour.
They were giving him what he deserved as the greatest sprinter of all time,
translation.ko: 역사상 최고 스프린터 자격에 걸맞은 대우는 받았어요

translation.en: which was the chance to go out
with a team that loved him, respected him, on his own terms.
translation.ko: 본인을 존중하는 팀과 자기 방식대로 출전했죠

translation.en: It was never to have a shot at the Tour de France.
translation.ko: 하지만 투르 드 프랑스 출전은 꿈도 안 꿨습니다

translation.en: [man] Patrick Lefevere has stated he's not taking him to the Tour,
and frankly, I don't know what that means for Mark Cavendish.
translation.ko: 제외라고 밝혔는데 당사자에게 어떤 의미일지 모르겠군요

translation.en: I was deflated then, you know.
[Vasilis] In cycling, you never know what can happen.
There are a lot of crashes, there are a lot unexpected situations.
translation.ko: 충돌도 빈번하고 뜻밖의 상황이 정말 많죠

translation.en: So I said, "Let's focus on the Tour de France,
translation.ko: 전 마크에게 못 갈 걸 알아도

translation.en: we know that you're not going to do it,
but let's prepare as if you're going to do the Tour de France."
He said, "Just go out to Italy."
"You never know what happens."
There was no chance.
There was no chance of him going to the Tour.
translation.ko: 마크가 투르 드 프랑스에 출전하는 일요

translation.en: I got a call from Peta, telling me, "Vasi, are you crazy?"
"Asking him to go away from his family again for no reason?"
"He's not going to do the Tour de France, Sam Bennett will."
translation.ko: '마크는 대회 출전 못 해요 샘 베넷이 갈 테니'

translation.en: We were like, "We're gonna have loads of time off now,
translation.ko: 저희는 쉴 시간이 많이 생긴 거고

translation.en: like, this is going to be fine."
Yeah, we were going to go away
and get to kind of come together and spend time with each other.
And then I said, "Peta, let him go."
[Mark] I was out doing, like, a super-long ride.
translation.ko: 전 나가서 정말 긴 거리를 달리고 있었어요

translation.en: And when I got in, I had a missed call from Head Sports Director.
translation.ko: 마치고 보니 수석 스포츠 감독이 전화를 했더군요

translation.en: Hello?
Sam Bennett had had a knee injury.
translation.ko: 샘 베넷이 무릎 부상을 당한 거예요

translation.en: There was a big discussion, how we go to the Tour de France.
translation.ko: 대회에 어떻게 출전할 것인지 엄청나게 논의했죠

translation.en: It was, like, 50-50, very much doubting Mark Cavendish.
translation.ko: 의견이 반반이었어요 마크에 대해 아주 회의적이었죠

translation.en: Then I said, "I want Mark." "Yeah, but you're crazy."
translation.ko: 마크를 보내자고 하니 다들 '또 저런다'는 반응이었는데

translation.en: I said, "No, I want Mark."
And, of course, at the end of the story, I'm the boss.
A bit speechless, like.
I was shocked.
[Patrick] I had a very good gut feeling.
Some things you can't explain.
You feel the ambition, you feel he wanted to race.
translation.ko: 전 그저 마크의 야심과 출전 의욕을 느꼈죠

translation.en: Champions, they are ready to do a lot of effort
translation.ko: 챔피언들은 세상에 내가 아직 끝나지 않았다는 걸 보여주기 위해

translation.en: to show the world, "I'm not done."
[Mark] I built my whole career around this race.
translation.ko: 제 선수 경력의 중심이 되는 대회였어요

translation.en: Nothing changes to just be buzzing to be here.
translation.ko: 대회에 도착하니 신나고 변한 건 없었죠

translation.en: It was such a pure joy that I had for him.
He got to go back to that race, back where he loved.
[Vasilis] At the start of the season, nobody ever thought
translation.ko: 시즌 시작 당시에는 그 누구도 마크가

translation.en: that Mark Cavendish was going to the Tour de France.
translation.ko: 투르 드 프랑스에 갈 거라 생각하지 않았어요

translation.en: It was out of the question.
He was a guy who couldn't finish a race for the last three years.
It's already, uh, more than a dream to be here.
translation.ko: 여기 있다는 것 자체가 꿈만 같은 일이에요

translation.en: [chuckles] Last minute call-up.
I have some self-belief, but even that, I wouldn't have believed.
translation.ko: 전 저를 믿는데도 여기 올 거란 예상은 못 했어요

translation.en: [man] Cav, he's been on top of the game forever.
translation.ko: 캐브는 오랜 시간 최고의 자리를 지킨 선수였어요

translation.en: I was teammates with him. That shows you how long it was.
translation.ko: 제 동료였던 적도 있으니 그만큼 선수 경력이 길죠

translation.en: That shows you how old he is.
Cavendish is 36 now.
I don't think it's going to happen. It would be an amazing story.
translation.ko: 우승할 것 같진 않지만 한다면 정말 멋지겠죠

translation.en: [Patrick] People like this.
The story of the…
the lost son
who has the chance to get back
on the biggest theater of the world in our sport.
If I wasn't able to win the Tour de France stage,
translation.ko: 제가 우승할 수 없을 것 같은 선수였다면

translation.en: I don't think I'd be in the Tour.
That's right, boss, no?
Like, I mean…
Everything was good enough for me because I paid him peanuts.
translation.ko: 마크 영입엔 쓴 돈도 적었으니 전 이미 만족스러웠어요

translation.en: So, who I am to ask somebody results if I pay him peanuts?
translation.ko: 또 푼돈에 제가 어찌 결과까지 요구하겠습니까?

translation.en: And I said, "I know this is really unfair what's happening."
translation.ko: 그래서 이랬죠, '지금 상황이 불공평하게 느껴질 것 알아'

translation.en: "You are here in the Tour de France with this shit salary,
translation.ko: '고작 그 돈 받고 투르 드 프랑스까지 왔으니'

translation.en: but I give you a bonus for every week you survive."
"And I give you a bonus for every stage you win."
[Mark] I was nervous.
It's a different level to the rest of cycling.
It's really a different level.
I hadn't been there for a few years, so I didn't know what to expect.
translation.ko: 참여 안 한 지도 몇 년 됐으니 어떨지 미지수였어요

translation.en: [Vasilis] I knew that he was strong enough to survive.
translation.ko: 전 마크가 살아남을 수 있는 강한 선수란 걸 알았어요

translation.en: I knew that he would suffer like a dog every day.
But Mark's a big, big champ and a big warrior.
[Vasilis] He's just going to win for his kids.
You know, Casper had never saw him winning.
translation.ko: 캐스퍼는 아빠가 우승하는 걸 못 봤거든요

translation.en: I had all of the kids at home.
With it on the TV.
[Delilah] You got this.
[Peta] The children are just over the moon and excited.
[Peta] But regardless of anything that happened now,
whether he left after a week,
whether he won no stages, whether he whatever, it didn't matter
because he'd got to go back to that race.
translation.ko: 마크는 그저 그 경주에서 달리기만 하면 됐거든요

translation.en: [commentator] The Tour de France is underway and the first attacks are beginning.
The fight is on.
A fairytale return for Mark Cavendish.
translation.ko: 마크 캐번디시는 동화 같은 복귀에 성공했는데요

translation.en: [Delilah] Go on!
It started so fast.
[commentator] Here, everybody's going for everything.
translation.ko: 다들 온 힘을 다해 달리는 모습입니다

translation.en: It was the Tour de France,
but a level up from where I'd left a few years ago.
translation.ko: 심지어 몇 년 만에 다시 오니 더 어렵게 느껴졌죠

translation.en: I… I remember thinking to myself, like,
"What the fuck have I done here?"
"Oh, shit."
[commentator] Oh, crash behind.
And I think that is a mass crash.
Really hectic right now
because there was a crash in the back of the peloton.
[commentator 1] Another rider down.
Huge crash behind! Oh, that's carnage!
[commentator 2] It's an absolute shocker.
This is exactly what we didn't want to happen
translation.ko: 대회 첫날인 오늘 저희가 부디 안 봤으면 했던

translation.en: on the opening day of the Tour de France.
Wow! It is absolutely crazy here.
[commentator 2] Yet another one! Sagan is down!
[commentator] Awful crashes that have taken their toll on the race already.
translation.ko: 끔찍한 충돌로 벌써 경기에 피해가 있었습니다

translation.en: We've got several riders very patched up here.
I just count myself lucky I didn't come down like some of the other guys.
translation.ko: 다른 선수들처럼 다치지 않은 건 운이 좋았어요

translation.en: This race.
We always talk about how dangerous the first week of the Tour is.
translation.ko: 저희가 투르 드 프랑스 첫 주의 위험성은 늘 얘기하죠

translation.en: These guys go to bed every night
praying they're not gonna hit the deck in the first week.
translation.ko: 대회 첫 주에 쓰러지지 않길 바라며 잠들어요

translation.en: [man 1] They are going a lot faster.
[man 2] Faster speeds than we've ever seen.
[commentator] It's not often you see that.
translation.ko: 흔히 볼 수 있는 광경이 아닙니다

translation.en: Not often you see that little display of vulnerability.
translation.ko: 선수가 약한 모습을 보이는 건 자주 있는 일이 아니에요

translation.en: [Vasilis] He was racing against the fastest sprinters in the world.
Most of them are really young, and,
in the normal, he cannot beat them.
translation.ko: 보통 때라면 이길 수 없는 상대들이었죠

translation.en: Last time I'd won at the Tour, I'd won in Fougères.
translation.ko: 그 대회에서 마지막으로 우승한 곳이 푸제르였는데

translation.en: I spoke to my teammates about it,
and said, "The most important thing is to get into that final right-hander
translation.ko: '마지막 우회전 구역에 있을 때 선두를 유지하는 게'

translation.en: near the front."
"Get me there and I'll do it."
translation.ko: '그것만 가능하게 해 주면 그 후는 내가 할게'

translation.en: [man] My pick is Cavendish.
Are you kidding me? You have these man-crushes.
And they take over your life.
No, Quick-Step, no.
Absolutely not.
[man] Well, we'll see.
[commentator 1] That's an awful lot of not just damaged equipment,
but damaged bodies in this peloton.
[commentator 2] I've never seen so many riders in bandages.
translation.ko: 붕대 감은 선수들을 이렇게 많이 보는 건 처음이네요

translation.en: Another thing I've seen is Mark Cavendish, who's stopped.
translation.ko: 마크 캐번디시가 멈춰 선 걸 봤는데요

translation.en: He did something on his handlebar or his cleats.
Bit of trouble there for Mark Cavendish.
[Casper] ♪ Come on, Daddy! ♪
[Peta] There had been a problem. He'd had a mechanical and dropped back.
translation.ko: 문제가 생겨서 기술자를 불렀고 그 결과 뒤처졌어요

translation.en: And it was like, "Oh, shit."
[commentator 1] So, we've got a breakaway.
[commentator 2] Don't be surprised about this rider disappearing
up the road and causing the peloton a huge problem.
translation.ko: 뒤쪽 무리에 혼란을 일으켜도 놀라지 마십시오

translation.en: [Peta] A breakaway is when a rider breaks away from the main peloton
and goes off on their own out at the front of the race.
[commentator] This is the time trial of his life.
It's going to be tight. The stage win is still possible.
[Peta] And you've got a group behind of 100-plus riders
translation.ko: 뒤로는 백 명 넘는 선수 무리가

translation.en: that are chasing you down.
I was looking at the times and working it out
and thinking, "They're leaving it very late."
"That is going to need a big pull to be on the front."
translation.ko: 추월하려면 엄청나게 밟아야 할 것 같았고요

translation.en: Mom, I don't know…
[Mark] Julian was in green, and I remember him just going on the front
translation.ko: 초록색 옷을 입은 줄리앙이 치고 나가

translation.en: and just pulling.
Just pulling with no thought other than catching the break.
translation.ko: 따라잡는 것 외엔 아무 생각 없이 그저 밟았어요

translation.en: [commentator] Mark Cavendish in the burn seat, just for the time being.
Where is he? Yes.
[commentator] What a night this is for Brent van Moer. Can he hold on?
translation.ko: 브렌트 선수에게 멋진 밤 같지만 견딜 수 있을까요?

translation.en: They're hunting him down. They're coming!
[Peta] Mark's in the middle of all of that. Daddy's blocked in.
[commentator] Look at this. 350 meters to go!
Can he be caught? It's going to be tight!
Oh, no, he's boxed in, he's boxed in.
He's in the middle of it.
Come on!
-Go! -Come on!
[commentator] There goes Mark Cavendish!
And here comes Mark Cavendish!
[Casper] Let's do it!
[commentator] He can possibly get there.
[Peta] Oh, my God, oh, my God.
[commentator] Mark Cavendish is going to do it. He's done it!
translation.ko: 마크 캐번디시가 해낼 것 같습니다 해냈어요!

translation.en: [Delilah] Daddy did it!
-Yes! -[Delilah] Daddy did it!
[commentator] That is unbelievable
in so many ways!
[Peta] He did it!
[Peta] Everything that we'd been through those last few years,
that holding on, that believing,
translation.ko: 지난 몇 년간 저희가 겪은 모든 게

translation.en: just all came out in one go.
[Mark] All I want to do is just see my boys, you know.
That's all I want to do.
Just nice to share this with them.
Fucking hell, Mark. You are so fucking fast.
translation.ko: 젠장, 마크 너 미친 듯이 빠르더라

translation.en: [Vasilis] To me, that was the biggest comeback. It's a dream.
translation.ko: 제 눈엔 가장 화려한 귀환이었어요, 꿈같았죠

translation.en: Even now I'm getting emotional because…
it was just something unbelievable,
what happened right then.
And I was so proud.
You know, being part of it.
It takes a lot for me to sit there and go, "Did I…"
translation.ko: 저는 상황 파악하는 데도 시간이 걸렸어요

translation.en: "I don't think I witnessed what I witnessed."
translation.ko: 이랬거든요 '지금 내가 본 게 사실일 리 없어'

translation.en: I'm shocked.
And at the same time, I'm so proud of him
and happy for him.
[man] Just to see what he's been through.
A lot of self-doubt, a lot of depression.
Um… I don't like being wrong,
but for this time, I'm really glad I was wrong.
[Patrick] I think it was like a fairytale, huh?
Somebody who was lost, given up by everybody.
It's like a dream. [laughing]
What are you doing to me?
I was near to a heart attack.
And then, taking his chance.
[Mark] Thank you, man.
You thank me already with what you did.
translation.ko: 자네가 한 일로 감사 인사는 다 했어

translation.en: And then winning.
Thank you for believing, for making me happy.
translation.ko: 저를 믿어 주시고 행복하게 해 주셔서 감사합니다

translation.en: The whole year, I'm just happy again.
People don't believe in miracles, me neither.
translation.ko: 사람들은 기적을 믿지 않죠 나도 그래요

translation.en: But we did it, and all the rest, fuck them.
translation.ko: 근데 우린 기적을 만들었고 나머지는 엿이나 먹으라고 합시다

translation.en: [Lance] Cav is back.
Today, he won his 31st stage,
only three behind the greatest of all time, Eddy Merckx.
translation.ko: 역대 최고인 메르크스 기록에서 고작 3승 부족하죠

translation.en: Really, really happy for him because, well, I told you.
translation.ko: 캐브가 우승해서 정말 기뻤습니다 전 예견한 일이었고요

translation.en: [commentator] Cavendish perfectly placed.
Daddy's led out.
Do it!
You can do it.
I miss him.
Mark Cavendish shakes two fists at the sky.
translation.ko: 마크 캐번디시가 두 주먹을 들고 흔듭니다

translation.en: [Lance] Dude…
speechless.
[reporter] Mark, it's your 32nd victory.
You know what my question is going to be.
-Don't say the name. -I didn't say it.
translation.ko: - 이름 언급하지 말아 주세요 - 얘기 안 했습니다

translation.en: I'm not thinking about anything.
translation.ko: 전 아무 생각도 하지 않고 있어요

translation.en: He knew he could beat all of them.
translation.ko: 마크는 참가 선수들을 모두 이길 수 있단 걸 알았어요

translation.en: Yeah, once he starts winning, he just can't stop.
translation.ko: 한 번 우승하고 나니 멈추질 않았죠

translation.en: [commentator] Cavendish in a near-perfect position here for win number 33.
When's he going to light it up?
The line belongs to him!
Thirty-three. Eddy, are you watching?
[reporter] I didn't ask you the question.
[laughs] Thank you. Oh shit yeah.
Daddy, Daddy!
[commentator] Are we going to see Eddy Merckx's record matched by Mark Cavendish?
translation.ko: 캐번디시가 메르크스의 기록을 세우는 걸 볼 수 있을까요?

translation.en: Cavendish, the Manx Missile, is he going to match Merckx?
translation.ko: 맨섬의 미사일 캐번디시가 메르크스의 기록을 세울 것인가!

translation.en: [laughing] He's done it!
Thirty-four stage wins!
We made history!
[in Italian] We made history!
[Lance] Unbelievable.
Now he has tied the record.
I never thought this would happen.
But I'm psyched for him.
And I'm done.
I'm done bashing on Mark Cavendish. I promise.
Yeah. Just…
I was in tears. The joy.
Just the… Oh, the emotion and joy that he got out of that.
translation.ko: 마크가 그 일로 느꼈을 감정과 기쁨

translation.en: That's huge. Huge, yeah.
Something that we'd spoken about in the darkest of his times.
translation.ko: 마크의 가장 어두운 시절에 저희가 얘기했던 것들이죠

translation.en: I know how far he has come.
translation.ko: 마크가 온 먼 길을 전 알았어요

translation.en: Yeah.
[Peta] Having to be broken and rebuild yourself,
translation.ko: 완전히 망가졌다가 재정비한 그 경험 덕분에

translation.en: I think it definitely made him
remember why he sacrifices what he sacrifices.
translation.ko: 여러 희생을 감수하는 이유를 상기하게 됐던 것 같아요

translation.en: [reporter] Mark, can I ask you the question?
What's it like to be the equal of Eddy Merckx?
translation.ko: 에디 메르크스와 대등한 선수가 된 기분은 어떤가요?

translation.en: It really brought a human side
translation.ko: 선수 생활을 통틀어서 제가 하는 일의

translation.en: to what I do for the first point in my career, really.
translation.ko: 인간적 측면을 생각하게 된 건 그때가 처음이었어요

translation.en: It made me realize
I didn't win it alone.
I wish I knew that.
I could go back and do my career again knowing that, you know.
translation.ko: 이걸 아는 채로 시간을 돌려 선수 생활을 다시 하고 싶어요

translation.en: This is how it was always supposed to be.
[in unison] We're so proud of you, Daddy.
[Lance] How sick would it be,
he's at 34,
coming into Paris, and he's still in the race,
translation.ko: 대회에 참가했고 여전히 남아 경주를 해요

translation.en: and that's the day to break the record?
translation.ko: 근데 심지어 기록 경신을 노려 보는 날이라니

translation.en: [man] You can't script that.
-You cannot script that. -Yeah.
You all right?
-Hi. -Can I give Daddy these?
-Look who it is! -[Mark] Hello!
[Casper] Hello, Dad!
Hi, Dad!
Daddy, you got me a present.
Hello.
[Peta] Daddy, have you got me my new green jersey?
[Casper] Daddy, what's that noise?
[Peta] Daddy's going to do his race. We'll see him at the finish.
translation.ko: 아빠는 이제 경주하러 갈 거야 결승선에서 다시 만나자

translation.en: -Love you! -Good luck, Daddy!
We're here now, just coming through on to the 1 km flag.
translation.ko: 이제 1km 지점을 알리는 깃발을 향해 다가가고 있습니다

translation.en: This is the Champs-Élysées.
The most beautiful finish to any bike race in the world.
translation.ko: 세계 자전거 대회를 통틀어 가장 아름다운 최종 코스죠

translation.en: I was very fortunate to do that with that man,
Mark Cavendish, who's going for number five today.
It's magic. Magic.
This is going to be my last transmission.
translation.ko: 제가 전해 드리는 소식은 이게 마지막일 겁니다

translation.en: I love it. I love this sport.
I'll hand you back to the commentary team. And come on, Mark!
translation.ko: 해설 팀에게 화면 넘겨 드리죠 힘내요, 마크!

translation.en: [commentator] Three weeks of racing in France, and it all comes down to this.
700 meters to go!
Onto the cobbles on the Champs-Élysées.
Cavendish battling for space. It's getting tight!
translation.ko: 캐번디시가 공간을 찾기 위해 애씁니다, 치열합니다!

translation.en: Cavendish, he's boxed in.
Van Aert takes it. Frustration for Cavendish.
translation.ko: 우승은 반 에어트가 가져갑니다 캐번디시가 아쉽게 됐군요

translation.en: Not to be in the end then, for Mark Cavendish,
but, boy, can he be proud of the last three weeks in France.
translation.ko: 지난 3주간의 여정으로 이미 자부심을 가질 만합니다

translation.en: Equaling the Merckx's record and taking the green jersey,
translation.ko: 메르크스의 기록을 따라잡고 초록색 운동복까지 얻었죠

translation.en: fully a decade after he last claimed it.
translation.ko: 마지막으로 입은 지 딱 10년 만의 일입니다

translation.en: No one has ever done that before.
[Mark] There's no number that's enough.
[Mark] But I've got the most incredible family…
You all right, mate?
With that alone, my life is perfect.
Daddy, did you win?
Daddy!
-Daddy! -[Peta] One minute.
What you doing?
-Daddy? -Casper, just give him a minute.
translation.ko: - 아빠 - 캐스퍼, 아빠한테 시간 좀 주자

translation.en: [Mark] I'll continue trying to win for as long as I believe I can win.
translation.ko: 전 이길 수 있다는 믿음이 있는 한 계속 우승을 위해 달릴 겁니다

translation.en: [in German] Good morning from Austria with Bernie Eisel.
